channel.title: About on Jan-Philipp Fränken
channel.description: Recent content in About on Jan-Philipp Fränken

item.title: About
item.description: Short Bio I am a 2-year PhD Student at The University of Edinburgh where I work together with Neil Bramley. I am broadly interested in both human and artificial intelligence. Currently, my work focuses on program induction (specifically, hypothesis adaptation) and probabilistic and causal reasoning in social networks. For my PhD research, I combine computational and agent-based models with interactive multi-player experiments. Publications Working Papers Fränken, J.P., Valentin, S., Lucas, C.
